item.description:
The Artist has been nominated for six Golden Globes, and I like the preview. I also like the story idea and the lead actor, the very dashing Jean Dujardin. And can you believe John Goodman is in this movie?! He's another favorite of mine. Should be an entertaining story about the switch from silent movies to the talkies.

*****From the theater website:

Hollywood 1927. Silent movie matinee idol George Valentin (Jean Dujardin, the star of OSS 117: Cairo, Nest of Spies) is enjoying the good life, although he seems fonder of his faithful dog than of his trophy wife (Penelope Ann Miller). He meets funny, sexy young extra Peppy Miller (Berenice Bejo), a dancer set for a big break, and sparks fly. With the advent of the talkies, George's career nosedives, while Peppy's takes off. The Artist is the charming and poignant story of their interlinked destinies -- a delightful valentine to the love of cinema, with a tip of the hat to Singin' in the Rain and A Star Is Born. Writer/director Michel Hazanavicius (who also directed the OSS 117 films) daringly shot the film completely in the style of a silent feature: in black and white and without sound (with a few striking exceptions). It is filmed on location in Hollywood and set to a wonderful original score by Ludovic Bource. Winner of the Best Actor Award (Dujardin) at the 2011 Cannes Film Festival. Co-starring John Goodman, Malcolm McDowell, and James Cromwell.

*****

You can find out more about The Artist at the theater website: http://www.landmarktheaters.com. If you click on the link for "Boston" on the left, then scroll down on the right to find the movie, you will also find a link for the movie's official website. Check out the preview!

I will purchase my ticket at about 6:30 p.m., then wait at the foot of the stairs in the theater lobby. Look for me and my red backpack. At about 6:45, I will move into the theater auditorium (can't miss the previews). You can find me there if you are late. The movie starts at 7:00 p.m.

After the movie, I will wait in the theater lobby to gather everyone. Look for the red backpack.

Please RSVP if you plan to attend this event so I know who to look for.

Marianne
